dublinCore.dc:title: S2154 ENR: Emergency Medical Services for Children Reauthorization Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.congress: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America
form.enrolled-dateline: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Friday, the third day of January, two thousand and fourteen
form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize the Emergency Medical Services for Children Program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Emergency Medical Services for Children Reauthorization Act of 2014.
Section 1910(d) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300w–9(d)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking and $30,387,656 and inserting $30,387,656; and
by inserting before the period , and $20,213,000 for each of fiscal years 2015 through 2019.

attestation-group.role: Speaker of the House of Representatives
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate
